dek: Kate Maxwell reports on the best art galleries in London's East End including Maureen Paley, Whitechapel Gallery, and Victoria Miro.
hed: The Best Art Galleries in London's East End

items.title:
1. Maureen Paley

2. Hotel

3. Herald Street
items.caption: **[Maureen Paley](http://www.maureenpaley.com/)** (pictured), the eponymous space of East London's contemporary-art grande dame (21 Herald St.; 20-7729-4112), is on the same Bethnal Green block as two other galleries: **[Hotel](http://www.generalhotel.org/)** (No. 4; 20-7729-3122) and **[Herald Street](http://www.heraldst.com/)** (No. 2; 20-7168-2566).

items.title: 4. White Cube
items.caption: Damien Hirst, Tracey Emin, Gilbert & George, and Antony Gormley are among the A-listers on gallerist Jay Jopling's books at the **[White Cube](http://whitecube.com/)**, his flagship gallery on Hoxton Square (No. 48; 20-7930-5373); he recently opened a third gallery south of the river (144-152 Bermondsey St.; 20-7930-5373).

items.title: 5. Victoria Miro Gallery
items.caption: The **[Victoria Miro Gallery](http://www.victoria-miro.com/)**, which opened in 2000, the same year as the White Cube, shows established and emerging artists: Turner Prize winners Chris Ofili and Grayson Perry; pioneering sculptor Conrad Shawcross (16 Wharf Rd.; 20-7336-8109).
items.credit: Grayson Perry, Courtesy Victoria Miro Gallery

items.title: 6. Kate MacGarry
items.caption: **[Kate MacGarry](http://www.katemacgarry.com/)** is the must-visit in Shoreditch (27 Old Nichol St.; 20-7613-0515).

items.title:
7. Wilkinson

8. Nettie Horn
items.caption:
On Vyner Street, hop between **[Wilkinson](http://www.wilkinsongallery.com/)** (pictured) (No. 50-58; 20-8980-2662) and **[Nettie Horn](http://www.nettiehorn.com/)** (No. 25B; 20-8980-1568).




 




_The [Fred [London]](http://www.fred-london.com/) gallery, which was included in the print version of this story, is in the process of moving from its Vyner Street location. The gallery will be opening in the West End in mid-May. Check its [website](http://www.fred-london.com/news.php?) for futher details. _

items.title: 9. Whitechapel Gallery
items.caption:
The original East End art space, the [**Whitechapel Gallery**](http://www.whitechapelgallery.org/) (pictured), has an excellent restaurant overseen by Gordon Ramsay disciple Angela Hartnett. The Whitechapel organizes bus and walking tours of some of the East End's 100 galleries and museums on the first Thursday of the month, when it's open until 9 p.m. (77-82 Whitechapel High St.; 20-7522-7888; entrées from $19).




**[The Frieze Foundation](http://www.friezefoundation.org/)**, which organizes the highly successful annual Frieze Art Fair (debuting in New York City this month, May 4–7), has commissioned Frieze Projects East—four new public art projects opening on June 25 as part of the 2012 London festival.

items.caption:

* [What's Inside Airline Amenity Kits](http://www.cntraveler.com/daily-traveler/2012/02/first-class-flight-amenity-kits-american-airlines-united-virgin.html)

* [The Most Romantic Places to Kiss](http://www.cntraveler.com/daily-traveler/2012/02/most-romantic-places-to-kiss-paris-new-york-italy.html)

* [Tour the Top Cruise Ships in the World](http://www.cntraveler.com/cruises/2012/02/photo-tours-top-20-cruise-ships-small-medium-large-river.html)
